top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Brazil’s brazilian coastal mountains gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel Brazil isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Brazil rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Brazil when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Brazil — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Gravel Brazil’s brazilian coastal mountains—steep technical terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Gravel Brazil’s brazilian coastal mountains—steep technical terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Brazil. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Brazil — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on brazilian coastal mountains—steep technical terrain.
Gravel Brazil’s 6,562ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Gravel Brazil count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Gravel Brazil’s 6,562ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Brazil’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Gravel Brazil demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride brazilian coastal mountains—steep technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: brazilian coastal mountains gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%), steep climbs. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 62 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 62 miles of brazilian coastal mountains—steep technical terrain in Balneário Camboriú, Santa Catarina, Brazil.
